Key Match Events: Wyatt Langford smashed a walk-off grand slam in the ninth inning, lifting the Texas Rangers to a 7-4 win over the New York Yankees on Tuesday in Arlington, Texas.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Texas Rangers left fielder Wyatt Langford (36) rounds the bases after he hits a two-run home run during the seventh inning against the New York Yankees at Globe Life Field in Arlington, Texas, Sept. 2, 2024.
Others: Rangers rookie reliever Walter Pennington (1-0) got the last out in the top of the ninth to earn his first major league win.
Texas trailed 4-1 before narrowing the deficit in the eighth.
Anthony Volpe went 2-for-4 with two RBIs and a run for the Yankees.
